description: Amendments to planning permission dated 1st October 2021 (RN:20/06914/FULL) for Variation of conditions 1, 31 and 35 of planning permission dated 4 March 2020 (RN 19/06767/FULL) (amended by 20/05397/NMA) which permitted the following development : Demolition of the existing buildings at 19-35 Baker Street, 88-110 George Street, 69-71 Blandford Street and redevelopment to create a mixed use scheme providing commercial uses and up to 51 residential units within a new ground plus nine storey building (and an enclosed plant area) on Baker Street; a new stepped ground plus four to ground plus six storey building on George Street; refurbishment, extension and the change of use of the first floor from office to residential at 30 Gloucester Place; creation of a single storey basement level linking the Baker Street and George Street buildings to provide car and cycle parking, refuse and servicing; creation of a new central, publicly accessible courtyard; removal of 5 trees and replacement trees across the site, a new publicly accessible route at ground level connecting Baker Street and Gloucester Place; associated plant, landscaping, replacement pavements in part and other associated works.NAMELY  for amendments to the lightwell terrace area to include the installation of steps and associated handrail, clarification of door position, addition of light fittings and surface mounted conduits to light fittings and external sockets, addition of wall mounted combined sounder/beacons and emergency exit signs; the addition of external light fittings on the north, south, west and east elevations; for amendments to the area of the arcade arches to include variation of the height of window heads, the addition of fixed steel plates, the addition of CCTV cameras, clarification on the design of the emergency key box and for amendments in the area of the south residential entrance to include variation to the location of post chute and intercom panels.
site_name: Dev Site At 19-35 Baker Street, 88-110 George Street, 69-71 Blandford Street And 30
